main_definition: To exert force in a way that causes something to move or be drawn towards oneself.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Attempting to solve a problem or situation with effort and determination.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was pulling all-nighters trying to finish her thesis on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Extracting something by force, especially from an object using physical power.
meanings_and_examples.example: He had no choice but to start pulling the stubborn bolt out of the machinery.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To draw or haul in a direction along with another person's assistance.
meanings_and_examples.example: We were pulling the heavy cart up the hill together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing that one is taking action to address an issue, often by initiating discussions or meetings.
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee members are pulling in different directions on this decision.
